intro: Palicourea mortoniana, commonly known as the Morton's palicourea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It typically grows as an erect shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. The fruit is a small, fleshy capsule that contains several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
